captions.text:
David Sirota with yet another great article
explaining the corruption of Chris Christie

so Christie of course as the governor gets
to make decisions about the pension funds

for the state of New Jersey and its workers
now conveniently he has made decisions that

enrich his wall street friends and disproportionately
so now let's explain so writing for the international

business times Sirota writes under Christ
Christie the New Jersey pension system paid

more than $600 million in fees to financial
firms in 2014 50% more than a year ago and

a higher rate than almost any other state
reports paying for pension management so understand

this somebody's got to manage the pension
money so that's normal and they're going to

get a fee for that they're not going to do
that out of the goodness of their own heart

the question is what kind of fee are they
getting and does it make sense is it anywhere

near the average so let's take a look at the
number first of all how has it gone under

Chris Christie take a look at this graphic
Sirota mentioned it was 50% higher over the

last year but if you look at before Chris
Christie came in it is significantly and massively

higher than when Christ Christie came in I'll
break down numbers exactly for you the year

before Christie became governor they spent
$125 million in fee which is you know significant

but it's a big pension fund they have in New
Jersey that makes sense in 2013 Christ Christie

has been in charge for some time now they
spent a whooping $398 million dollars and

then last year in 2014 over $600 million the
rate of increase is gigantic it's almost five

times the size of what they spent before Christ
Christie came in now you wonder why Wall Street

loves Chris Christie how did Chris Christie
become one of the establishment Republicans

who was leading in this race before all of
these stories about corruption came out well

it's because the establishment Republicans
who fund the Republican candidates love this

corruptions that's why they give the money
you know something those Republicans say big

government is corrupt you're right who corrupted
them these guys because in returns they hundreds

of millions of dollars alright more from the
article here in all since Christie took office

his administration has spent $1.5 billion
dollars of retirees pension money on Wall

Street fees now again you need to pay some
fees so is that normal 1.5 billion well let's

listen had the Christie administration maintained
the fee level the state was paying in the

year before the governor took office the pension
system would have saved more than $914 million

think about that man Christ Christie with
his decision to enrich his wall street friends

cost the state of New Jersey the pension system
for those retirees $914 million I hope he

enjoyed the donations that he got OK now how
is New Jersey in comparison to other places

well under Christie the New Jersey pension
systems has delivered returns that have trailed

the median for similarly sized pension funds
the state's high fee alternative investment

portfolio has also lagged behind the S&P 500
so wait a minute if you can't even keep up

with the S&P 500 what are you paying all those
fees for if you're trailing the median for

similarly sized pension funds what are you
paying all those fees for the fees aren't

getting you a better result they're just getting
a better result for the pocket books and wallets

of the wall street friends that Chris Christie
has decided to give those contracts to alright

now more comparisons here New Jersey tax payers
are now spending 67 cents on fees per $100

under management that is more than triple
the fee rate since Christie took office in

2010 and more than 50% higher than the median
for a state pension systems according to a

2013 report by the Maryland public policy
institute no only are they paying more than

the other states they're paying 50% more than
the median for other states so this is out

of proportion last week Christie's pension
commission and this is the thing that really

rubs salt in the wounds here Christie's pension
commission calling for cuts to guaranteed

retirement income and health benefits for
public workers the report did not include

trying to reduce financial fees among its
suggested pension reforms so after they spent

all that money in fees to wall street fat
cats they then turn around and go oh we need

reform we don't have enough money OK great
you want to reform the fees that wall street

gets oh no way no way that money keep getting
funneled over to wall street those are republican

donors they need to be catered to this is
why they get upset at Obama cause this is

the corruption that wall street is used to
and actually wall street was the number one

donor for Obama in 2008 and did plenty of
favors for them they did the bail outs they

did the did the fed gave over $7 trillion
dollars in money helped prop up the banking

system they did all but it wasn't enough you
should have done more corruption like this

you should have just given me pension funds
to managers I should get to charge exorbitant

fees and deliver no results for you oh Obama
didn't do that enough Chris Christie on the

other hand the guy goes on the boardwalk seems
like the common man yelling at people pretending

to be a tough guy average guy no no he's bathed
in corruption he was born in it to quote Bane

alright and finally this again insult to injury
here the move obscuring the increase and remember

they tried to hide some of these fees cause
they got embarrassed instead of fees they

called it an allocation oh that's really different
so the move obscuring the increase in reported

fees also comes on the heels of Christie telling
New Jersey teachers fire fighters cops and

other public workers that there are no alternatives
to cutting their retirement benefits because

the state pension system is strapped for cash
there are no alternatives then they turn around

and they so oh the Democrats and De Blasio
are against cops this guy is taking money

out of cop's retirement funds let alone the
firefighters and the teacher he knows that

he's spending $914 million more in fees to
wall street and he say oh no there's nothing

I can do oh I had to give them $900 million
more in fees you I got to cut your pension

vote for these guys at your peril you think
he's a common guy you have no idea the whole

point of Chris Christie is political corruption
and crony capitalism

title: Chris Christie Caught Stealing $1 Billion From Pensions
